para.text: feature, there are other ways you can bring survey data into Walls. The native formats of several other cave mapping programs can be converted to the

with separate command line utilities. These programs are either packaged with Walls or are available upon request. For the most part, they were created to import data for a few specific projects and have not been extensively tested.
With each of the following programs, you can submit the DOS command without arguments to display available options:

list.style: text-indent:-13px; margin-left:13px; tabstops:13px left ; font-family:Symbol; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;

li.text: will convert the data files used by Bob Thrun's

program. Normally it reads one CMAP file and additionally any "included" files to create a single SRV file. Used a different way, it can generate multiple SRV files and an associated project script. The names of included files can optionally define

In the output, comments prefixed with ";!" will flag measurements whose units had to be changed. This utility was developed before the Walls data format supported quadrant-style bearings and the different taping methods.

list.style: text-indent:-13px; margin-left:13px; tabstops:13px left ; font-family:Symbol; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;

li.text: will convert files having the CSS format as documented by Larry Fish for his

program. Only DAT files, not MAK files, are processed. Survey names within a data file can be defined as segments, as can the year or year/month. Also, measurement data are converted back to their original type and units so that the resulting SRV files match what would appear in the COMPASS editor. This utility at least supports the version of CSS current as of Spring 1999. Recent Walls distributions have included CSS2SRV.EXE and a documentation file, CSS2SRV.TXT.

list.style: text-indent:-13px; margin-left:13px; tabstops:13px left ; font-family:Symbol; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;

li.text: will convert "vector" report files generated by CVREPORT.EXE, a program accompanying John Fogarty's
. Before creating the report, the format options should be set to exclude headings, margins, and page numbers.

list.style: text-indent:-13px; margin-left:13px; tabstops:13px left ; font-family:Symbol; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;

li.text: will convert data files generated by the

. It will process all files matching a given file spec (e.g., *.ELI) to create a corresponding set of SRV files. Unfortunately, at least one version of CaveView omits "height corrections" from the exported Ellipse data. Therefore, if the original data contains height corrections, utility CV2SRV (see above) should be used instead.
